body:
I tried to get the output path via [starlark:expr](https://bazel.build/query/cquery#output-format-definition-examples) `--starlark:expr="' '.join([f for f in target.files.to_list()])"` but did not get the right file either. 
Maybe I'm not selecting the right output group?
`cquery` seems to apply the aspect (verified via `print`). The output group or the aspect provider however can not be found / accessed.
@gregestren Would you expect the information about output groups created by aspects to be available in cquery?

Immediate intuition is no, since `cquery` doesn't parse aspects as thoroughly as configured targets: see https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/16310 and https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/16310#issuecomment-2113976408.

issue.title: Include aspect output groups in `cquery --output=files` output

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Files in requested aspect output groups are built and reported with `build` and should thus also be printed with `cquery --output=files`.

Fixes #24612

issue.title: [8.4.0] Include aspect output groups in `cquery --output=files` output

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Manual merge of
https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/6d242ff07095cec2a1b6a8d9e1d9b2d0c90eafc5.

Files in requested aspect output groups are built and reported with `build` and should thus also be printed with `cquery --output=files`.

Fixes #24612
Fixes #26545.

Closes #26544.

PiperOrigin-RevId: 786156675
Change-Id: Ifd14bcbf43104bf78b1e3bbcf68fe19b8d9128d3

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in[Bazel 8.4.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.4.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.4.0rc1. Thanks!
